title: Meesho-like marketplace app for printed T‑shirts (buyer + seller flows)

requirements.text: Create a cohesive Meesho-inspired marketplace UX for a printed T‑shirt business, with a consistent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) applied across all pages.

quotes: So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: App UI uses a single consistent design system (colors/type/spacing) across pages.
No user-facing text is left as placeholder lorem ipsum; all user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity authentication and show signed-in user context in the UI (signed-out state, sign-in button, sign-out control).

quotes: So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: A signed-out user can sign in using Internet Identity.
A signed-in user can sign out and returns to signed-out state.
UI clearly indicates whether the user is signed in.

requirements.text: Build the buyer storefront flow: product listing page with search and filters (at minimum: price range and size), product detail page (images, description, sizes/colors, price), and add-to-cart functionality with cart page and quantity updates.

quotes: I wana make a business of printed t shirts
So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: Users can browse a grid/list of T‑shirt products.
Search filters visible products by keyword.
Filters can narrow products by price range and size.
Product detail page shows all key product information and allows selecting size/color (when available).
Cart persists within the session and supports add/remove/update quantity.
Cart shows item totals and overall total.

requirements.text: Build a simple checkout flow that creates an order (no external payments): collect shipping details (name, phone, address), confirm order summary, and submit the order to the backend.

quotes: So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: Checkout form validates required fields before submission.
Submitting checkout creates an order record in the backend tied to the signed-in user.
After successful submission, user sees an order confirmation page with an order ID and summary.

requirements.text: Add buyer order history: a page where signed-in users can view their orders and status (e.g., Placed, Confirmed, Shipped, Delivered, Cancelled) and open an order detail view.

quotes: So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: Signed-in users can view a list of their orders.
Each order displays status and total.
Selecting an order shows order items, shipping details, timestamps (if stored), and current status.

requirements.text: Implement backend marketplace data model and APIs in the single Motoko actor to support: product catalog CRUD (for sellers/admin), product listing with basic query parameters (search, filters), cart-independent order creation, and per-user order retrieval.

quotes: I wana make a business of printed t shirts
So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores products and orders in stable state so data persists across upgrades.
Backend exposes methods to: list products, get product by ID, create/update/delete product (restricted), create order, list orders for caller, get order by ID (restricted to owner/admin).
Product listing supports at least keyword search and filter parameters used by the frontend.

requirements.text: Add a seller/admin dashboard UI to manage products: create product (title, description, price, sizes, colors, images), edit product, delete product, and view a list of existing products.

quotes: So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: There is a protected dashboard area accessible only to authorized principals (admin/seller).
Authorized users can create, edit, and delete products, and changes are reflected in the buyer storefront.
Unauthorized users cannot access backend product management methods.

requirements.text: Seed the app with a small set of demo printed T‑shirt products (including multiple sizes/colors) so the storefront is usable immediately after deployment.

quotes: I wana make a business of printed t shirts

acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh deployment, the storefront shows multiple sample products without requiring manual product entry first.
Seed data includes at least 6 products with varied prices and at least 2 sizes per product.

requirements.text: Generate and add required static images to the app and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (not via backend).

quotes: So create a app like meesho

acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Frontend references these images as static assets (e.g., in header/hero/empty states) without calling the backend to fetch them.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not add external databases or third-party auth providers; use Internet Identity only.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose existing UI components instead.
nonGoals: Integrating real payment providers (Stripe/UPI/cards) or external checkout.
Shipping carrier integrations, live tracking, label generation, or address validation APIs.
Social/reseller referral network features (commissions, invite trees) beyond basic buyer/seller flows.
Native mobile apps (iOS/Android) or React Native implementation.

required: Homepage hero banner featuring printed T‑shirts laid out in a clean marketplace style (hero-banner.dim_1600x600.png)
Empty-state illustration with shopping bag and T‑shirt motif (empty-state.dim_1200x800.png)
Neutral product placeholder image with T‑shirt silhouette (product-placeholder.dim_800x800.png)
